## 121                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             well i ordered a big boy chair, and man oh man i got one :) when i first saw the seat, i reverted to an episode of the simpsons.... "i'm looking for mr. gass, mr hugh gass." lol. the chair rocks. i got it because i was getting sick of chairs that collapse down on me after a few months. this chair is comfortable to me at its lowest setting, so as far as i am concerned i think i have the final chair i will have to buy. but it has been only 2 months now, so time will be the real judge of that one.
## 122                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         Bought this for my home office. It's easy to assemble. The wheels work well on my carpet. It's sturdy enough, overall. It's big! It's probably larger than what I needed, or realized when I bought it. But it works! I have lower back disc issues and a bruised tail bone. I use a special butt-pillow while sitting on this (and any) chair. So far I haven't had any pain arise while using this chair. The back rest is mesh and very firm. I guess that's good considering the weight it's supposed to support. The lumbar piece is really firm, too, which I dislike, but then again, my back hasn't had any problems with it as it does with other office chairs, so maybe this firmness is what my back needs. The seat cushion of the chair is cushy and I could see it being uncomfortable and flattened after prolonged use, so I'd recommend buying an additional cushion if you're like me and have back/butt issues. The arms are adjustable up/down. Since the seat is extra wide, the arms aren't squishing into my sides. The back doesn't recline independently from the chair (a feature my in-office chair has) but rather the whole seat tilts back slightly (not very far). Overall, good chair.
## 123                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          The good, I'm a tall big dude, 6'5" 280lbs so its hard to find chairs that are comfortable and at least right now this is comfortable. It also seems to be made out of decently thick steel for the most part which gives me hope it will last a decent period of time. Putting it together was pretty easy, took maybe 30min, they give you an allen key that you can torque without hurting your hand which is nice, they even give you spare screws.The bad, it doesn't use standard parts. The gas cylinder is a class 4 which is good but its only 14" long and an inch of that ends up below the chair, standard size is 15.5" so its not very good for tall people. Also, by the amount it sank when I sat in it, I doubt it will have decent longevity before it starts sinking and needs to be replaced. I have to have it on the highest height in order to be at a normal desk height. Also, the wheels are also not a standard one, they're tiny which is fine for looks but if you roll over even the smallest bump in the floor it gets stuck, also something you'll probably have to replace in the future. The bottom piece is not one piece, it’s how IKEA does it where the legs are screwed into the centre which reduces its longevity. Lastly, the lumbar support only moves 2 inches and is quite small so it doesn't really end up in my lower back.All in all, like I said in the title, if you can get it on sale which I did for 163 CAD including the 30 dollar shipping, its a good deal if you compare it to the other chairs for those of use descended from giants, which are closer to 250 or 300 but don't expect a chair that doesn't creak or wobble a bit cuz it does and made vary clear by the numerous large stickers all over it, its very much made in china.
## 124                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   Firstly, the chair does what it says. I've loved it and it's served me well. I'm 6'0 and pushing 400 so it definitely held up its end...for a year.  Within 9 months the back plastic piece along the middle broke and wouldn't stay on.  It's no doubt associated with the weight being pushed onto the ergonomic piece and back into the plastic.  I wasn't upset at that, it's simply an aesthetic piece which served no real purpose.The part I'm mad about though is the seat plate. Around 6 months in the lever to keep it from leaning started to slip and I'd jolt backwards, not the end of the world, I just stopped leaning back as much and checked the lever more frequently.  However, after a slip I noticed the chair had a slight lean to the left where the lever sticks into. I examined it and noticed that some parts had broke and small metal bits were cracked. it's progressively gotten worse and now after a year, I cannot use the chair as it's lean is constant and unsustainable for my back.I wish products advertised as size friendly would also have the same durability as those meant for smaller folk.
## 125                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                I would recommend this to anyone that is needing an office chair, I love the wide seat and that the lumbar support can be adjusted and that it stays in place...this chair is highly recommended
## 126                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       I got this chair about 6 months ago when I got a job working full time from home - so I have spent 8-9 hours a day in this chair for the last 6 months. I am 5 foot 5 and weigh over 350 pounds. I am also very hippy - I carry that weight in my butt and thighs. This chair is wide enough to accommodate  my massive backside.When I was putting it together a small piece of plastic that was part of the back broke, so the back did not come together as tightly as it should. Picture 2 shows the gap - but I could not tell that it caused any functional issues so I let it be.With my weight and the casters that were provided, I was hurting my knees getting the chair to move - so I replaced the casters that came with the chair with the rollerblade type casters - that solved that problem. I also added arm cushions to the arm rests. I like the adjustability of the arm rests - they seem to stay put wherever you put them so you can get the height to meet your needs.I have had no problem keeping the chair at the right height - although I now have it at the lowest position because this is most comfortable for my legs.The lumbar support pillow behind the back slides up and down, but does not stay where I put it and ends up down at the bottom by the end of the day. Since I do have a big backside I need the lumbar to be higher.My big issue is that I seem to have worn down any support that existed in the seat cushion. By the end of the day my butt just hurts. I have tried adding a cushion, but that makes the chair too tall for me to easily get in to it. (One of the unspoken issues with being large and trying to sit in a chair with wheels is that you can easily shoot the chair across the room and end up on the floor if you can't sit down into it with enough of your behind in the chair.)I think this chair would be perfectly fine if I was only using it a few hours a day. In fact, I'm good in it for about 4-5 hours a day. It just does not work for me for all day and I have ordered a more expensive chair.

He tenido la necesidad de, después de montar y probar la silla por un par de horas, venir corriendo para deciros que NO LA COMPREIS! Pido perdón adelantado por si me sale alguna palabrota, pues estoy muy, muy, muy cabreado con la porquería que me ha llegado.Es, sinceramente, la peor silla que he tenido en toda mi vida. Os juro que no exagero. Suelo pasarme entre 4 y 8 horas delante del ordenador al día, y siempre he tenido sillas de oficina normales. Por una vez pensé que una silla de estas "gaming" podría dar el pego con mi nuevo setup y decidí lanzarme. Cagada total.Incómoda: los cojines son muy delgados y demasiado blandos, y el respaldo queda muy alejado de los reposabrazos, que solo son regulables en altura. El tejido me ha parecido demasiado caliente, de los que te hacen sudar de valiente, y mira que estamos en pleno invierno (estoy a 16º en mi oficina). No me quiero imaginar como sería esta porquería en verano.Malísima calidad: la tela es de lo peor que he visto nunca en una silla. Incluso una silla de oficina de 60-80€ tiene mejores telas. Solo de abrir el paquete, han saltado 4 grapas de debajo el asiento y ya hay un trozo de tela suelto en una esquina inferior. Las ruedas son de plástico barato, al igual que la base.Montaje: tedioso. Ni te plantees montarla con las herramientas que trae. Te vas a desesperar. En muchos agujeros, los tornillos se encallan por los trozos de tela que se meten en la rosca. Hay algún par de agujeros que no encajan y tienes que forzar un poco.Sinceramente quería echar unas fotos y colgarlas, pero es que no pienso perder más tiempo en esto, que entre el montaje y escribir esta reseña ya llevo 2 horas. Ahora solo pensar que tengo que desmontarlo todo para que se la puedan llevar de vuelta me da dolor de cabeza.Lo que más rabia me da es que es una silla de unos 230€. Con 230€ cualquier persona se puede pensar que es una silla tirando más a premium que a básica, pero no. Sinceramente me siento muy estafado. Hasta he enviado un correo a los fabricantes cagándome en ellos y para pedirles que paren de estafar a la gente.Es más, compré esta silla reacondicionada, sin los cojines (de los que no puedo opinar, aunque los he sustituido por unos parecidos de una silla de un colega para poder decidir si compraba unos a parte o no) por 90€ y aún me siento muy estafado. He tenido sillas de 50€ que le dan diez mil vueltas a esta porquería, en comodidad y en calidad. Sinceramente, que Amazon tenga listado este producto me parece un insulto y una falta de respecto para sus clientes. No la querría ni gratis, y no va nada en broma.Espero que mi reseña le parezca útil a alguien, y que no se deje engañar por posibles reseñas compradas, que últimamente Amazon está lleno.

## 202                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   Es la primera vez que hago una reseña en amazon. He tenido la necesidad de, después de montar y probar la silla por un par de horas, venir corriendo para deciros que NO LA COMPREIS! Pido perdón adelantado por si me sale alguna palabrota, pues estoy muy, muy, muy cabreado con la porquería que me ha llegado.Es, sinceramente, la peor silla que he tenido en toda mi vida. Os juro que no exagero. Suelo pasarme entre 4 y 8 horas delante del ordenador al día, y siempre he tenido sillas de oficina normales. Por una vez pensé que una silla de estas "gaming" podría dar el pego con mi nuevo setup y decidí lanzarme. Cagada total.Incómoda: los cojines son muy delgados y demasiado blandos, y el respaldo queda muy alejado de los reposabrazos, que solo son regulables en altura. El tejido me ha parecido demasiado caliente, de los que te hacen sudar de valiente, y mira que estamos en pleno invierno (estoy a 16º en mi oficina). No me quiero imaginar como sería esta porquería en verano.Malísima calidad: la tela es de lo peor que he visto nunca en una silla. Incluso una silla de oficina de 60-80€ tiene mejores telas. Solo de abrir el paquete, han saltado 4 grapas de debajo el asiento y ya hay un trozo de tela suelto en una esquina inferior. Las ruedas son de plástico barato, al igual que la base.Montaje: tedioso. Ni te plantees montarla con las herramientas que trae. Te vas a desesperar. En muchos agujeros, los tornillos se encallan por los trozos de tela que se meten en la rosca. Hay algún par de agujeros que no encajan y tienes que forzar un poco.Sinceramente quería echar unas fotos y colgarlas, pero es que no pienso perder más tiempo en esto, que entre el montaje y escribir esta reseña ya llevo 2 horas. Ahora solo pensar que tengo que desmontarlo todo para que se la puedan llevar de vuelta me da dolor de cabeza.Lo que más rabia me da es que es una silla de unos 230€. Con 230€ cualquier persona se puede pensar que es una silla tirando más a premium que a básica, pero no. Sinceramente me siento muy estafado. Hasta he enviado un correo a los fabricantes cagándome en ellos y para pedirles que paren de estafar a la gente.Es más, compré esta silla reacondicionada, sin los cojines (de los que no puedo opinar, aunque los he sustituido por unos parecidos de una silla de un colega para poder decidir si compraba unos a parte o no) por 90€ y aún me siento muy estafado. He tenido sillas de 50€ que le dan diez mil vueltas a esta porquería, en comodidad y en calidad. Sinceramente, que Amazon tenga listado este producto me parece un insulto y una falta de respecto para sus clientes. No la querría ni gratis, y no va nada en broma.Espero que mi reseña le parezca útil a alguien, y que no se deje engañar por posibles reseñas compradas, que últimamente Amazon está lleno.

## 220                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             I guess you get what you pay for - I was disappointed that the seat cushion was about a half-inch taller on the left side than the right. I'm trying to even it out by adding a blanket folded so fewer layers are on the lower side. The challenge is I also had to add a two-inch seat cushion for this chair to be at an ergonomic height for a standard desk. Otherwise, the desk was higher than my elbows and therefore would not be at 90 degrees. I am 5' 5" tall - which is an average height for many women. I would not recommend this chair - the only good features were that it was easy to assemble and the back support would be great if I didn't have to raise myself up to get my elbows to the right height.  I guess if your tall and don't have back issues (like I do), sitting a tilt wouldn't bother you... but it sure bothers me since I have a herniated disc at L4-L5. The cushion I have to use brings my lower back up too high to enjoy the back support.

## 366                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    The chair arrived with a tear in the armrest, but the costumer service was excellent and the chair is great. The chair arrived in a large box and everything was packaged either with bubble wrap or in its own box. I received all of the pieces and instructions. They give you all of the tools you need to put the chair together and it only took me about 8 minutes or so to put together. Upon arrival, one of the arms of the chair had  tear in the fabric. I assembled it anyways, and decided I would try to my fate with customer services. On the outside of the box that the chair arrived in, there was a customer service line. It said to call this number instead of returning. I called the number was greeted quickly. The woman on the phone was quick. She asked me if I still had the box, and ask for me to read her a number off the shipping label. I did that and it pulled up my shipping address and contact information and she knew who I was and my information without me having to tell them over the phone. Then she asked if I still had the instructors to assemble the chair, I told her yes, and she asked me to find the part I needed replace and look for the part number next to it. I gave her the information, and she said it would ship the next day and asked if I would like an e-mail with the tracking information. I said yes. I actually received an e-mail with the tracking information and I received the replacement part. Not only that, I received two arms. The entire process was painless and quick. Possibly the best, fastest and easiest costumer service I've ever experienced. The chair is a bright white. It tilts back, raises and lowers easily. Spins. The assembly was simple. The product exceeds my expectations and so did the costumer service.

## 375                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    Overall, this chair was mostly fine with one serious problem: the back isn't well supported. It looks like a solid back but it's just a metal frame with fabric and elastic in the interior of the back. When I lean back into the chair, the back just gives way (see second picture). My last chair had a continuous board in the very back so that the back padding compressed against something sturdy. This chair just seems to have an elastic band buried in there. Even worse, I can feel it when I lean back. Another minor gripe is that the chair felt a bit small but that could just be that I'm used to somewhat oversized chairs and I like to sit cross-legged in the chair sometime.Other than that, the chair was fine. It arrived on time and undamaged. The packaging was reasonable and assembly was quick. There were some minor imperfections (first and third pictures) but nothing serious. Disassembly was a bit of a PITA but that's not really the manufacturer's fault.It looks pretty nice. Too bad it doesn't feel that nice.

## 380 UPDATE 1 Year Review: The positives I gave this chair some credit for on my initial reviews was looks and cushion. Well, after using this chair 3-5 days a week while working from home for a year, I can honestly say the initial cushion quality has gone out the window. The cushion has not held up....to the point where I’m shopping for a new chair already and I plan on spending a lot more money to get a sturdy, higher quality chair. This chai wobbles and moves in places it shouldn’t now, I feel the cheap sub material through the cushion now, and so honestly regret this purchase. It looks decent and is okay if you’re a lighter/smaller person it might be good for the only, but otherwise run away.I originally posted this review with a 4 star rating, but after working from home for a week on it, I am updating my review to sow a 3 star rating based on how uncomfortable I feel sitting in it for a long period of time. It has its upside but ultimately it is a small/tight fitting chair that is now with the money for taller people wanting it for regular use.Cons:I saw some reviews talking about how narrow the arm rests/seat area is. I figured these were picky or oversized people. Turns out they were right. Compared to my prior chair from Office Max, this chair is WAY more narrow. I’m 6’3” and “normal” sized/athletic shaped and slender....my hips are right at the arm rests (not touching but very close). Compared to my old chair, the arm rests also extend towards the front of the seat more....coupled with the narrow seat opening, the arm rests length makes it harder to get out of the chair at an angled direction. I have to swivel my chair completely sideways and stand up straight instead of partially turning and sliding in or out sideways. Also, the seat is not only narrow sideways but is is “short” longways.... sitting all the way back, the seat goes about halfway toward my knees.... my old chair went almost to my knee area (difference that is noticeable in comfort/weight distribution ). It seats almost like a driver side seat in a car given how most of your weight is on just your butt and instead of spread down your hamstrings, too. The chair just seems disproportionate and smaller than it should be. Smaller people might be good though. Last complaint is I ordered a black chair and they mailed me a white one. Easily fixed but still annoying and shouldn’t happen.Pros:Whatever shortcomings it has in comfort because of design/size, it at least got it right in the padding. This chair is one of the more comfortable home office chairs I’ve sat in under $200 when it comes to the seat cushion. The padding seems to be thick and solid without being too supportive or too soft. Aside from that, the overall look is very sharp. The chrome is nicely done and spruces the chair’s appearance up. They did a good job on the overall look. Also, the chair went together quite easily. Packaging was good, too.Conclusion:While there is enough of a cramped seat feeling to make it worth 2 stars deduction, and if it was too much smaller I would have returned it, the chair is nice enough looking and cushioned enough to make the $105 chair worth keeping now that I have it...and at the end of the day it is just big enough to work. I work from home and have already spent several hours sitting and it seems to be a a decision I’ll be able to live with, but I wouldn’t order it again if I could do it all over.

## 400 UPDATE 1 Year Review: The positives I gave this chair some credit for on my initial reviews was looks and cushion. Well, after using this chair 3-5 days a week while working from home for a year, I can honestly say the initial cushion quality has gone out the window. The cushion has not held up....to the point where I’m shopping for a new chair already and I plan on spending a lot more money to get a sturdy, higher quality chair. This chai wobbles and moves in places it shouldn’t now, I feel the cheap sub material through the cushion now, and so honestly regret this purchase. It looks decent and is okay if you’re a lighter/smaller person it might be good for the only, but otherwise run away.I originally posted this review with a 4 star rating, but after working from home for a week on it, I am updating my review to sow a 3 star rating based on how uncomfortable I feel sitting in it for a long period of time. It has its upside but ultimately it is a small/tight fitting chair that is now with the money for taller people wanting it for regular use.Cons:I saw some reviews talking about how narrow the arm rests/seat area is. I figured these were picky or oversized people. Turns out they were right. Compared to my prior chair from Office Max, this chair is WAY more narrow. I’m 6’3” and “normal” sized/athletic shaped and slender....my hips are right at the arm rests (not touching but very close). Compared to my old chair, the arm rests also extend towards the front of the seat more....coupled with the narrow seat opening, the arm rests length makes it harder to get out of the chair at an angled direction. I have to swivel my chair completely sideways and stand up straight instead of partially turning and sliding in or out sideways. Also, the seat is not only narrow sideways but is is “short” longways.... sitting all the way back, the seat goes about halfway toward my knees.... my old chair went almost to my knee area (difference that is noticeable in comfort/weight distribution ). It seats almost like a driver side seat in a car given how most of your weight is on just your butt and instead of spread down your hamstrings, too. The chair just seems disproportionate and smaller than it should be. Smaller people might be good though. Last complaint is I ordered a black chair and they mailed me a white one. Easily fixed but still annoying and shouldn’t happen.Pros:Whatever shortcomings it has in comfort because of design/size, it at least got it right in the padding. This chair is one of the more comfortable home office chairs I’ve sat in under $200 when it comes to the seat cushion. The padding seems to be thick and solid without being too supportive or too soft. Aside from that, the overall look is very sharp. The chrome is nicely done and spruces the chair’s appearance up. They did a good job on the overall look. Also, the chair went together quite easily. Packaging was good, too.Conclusion:While there is enough of a cramped seat feeling to make it worth 2 stars deduction, and if it was too much smaller I would have returned it, the chair is nice enough looking and cushioned enough to make the $105 chair worth keeping now that I have it...and at the end of the day it is just big enough to work. I work from home and have already spent several hours sitting and it seems to be a a decision I’ll be able to live with, but I wouldn’t order it again if I could do it all over.

Overall, this chair was mostly fine with one serious problem: the back isn't well supported. It looks like a solid back but it's just a metal frame with fabric and elastic in the interior of the back. When I lean back into the chair, the back just gives way (see second picture). My last chair had a continuous board in the very back so that the back padding compressed against something sturdy. This chair just seems to have an elastic band buried in there. Even worse, I can feel it when I lean back. Another minor gripe is that the chair felt a bit small but that could just be that I'm used to somewhat oversized chairs and I like to sit cross-legged in the chair sometime.Other than that, the chair was fine. It arrived on time and undamaged. The packaging was reasonable and assembly was quick. There were some minor imperfections (first and third pictures) but nothing serious. Disassembly was a bit of a PITA but that's not really the manufacturer's fault.It looks pretty nice. Too bad it doesn't feel that nice.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   I read other people's reviews before buying, and many said that assembly was very easy. I found that not to be the case. Maybe we ended up with a defective one, but none of the holes for the screws lined up properly. It took both my husband and I a good part of the afternoon to put this together. I generally do not have an issue putting things like this together. Once it was finally together, it looks like a decent chair for the price.
## 471                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    I bought this chair for my 6 yr old to use for virtual learning at home.  It's a cheap office chair, but she's little, so no big deal.  It was easy to assemble.  It's comfortable enough.  BUT - the hydraulic is shot within 45 days of use by a 6 yr old...  She's not constantly adjusting it up and down.  Over time, any weight in the seat lowers the hydraulic instantly.  Now she can't sit high enough to be at her desk.  I tried to return it, but Amazon said I'd need to box it up.  Nobody has time to disassemble a busted chair and find a box for it to fit in.Learn from my lesson.  Buy a different chair.  Or buy this one and go ahead and buy a replacement hydraulic lift cylinder because you're going to need one.
## 472                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               I purchased this chair for fifty dollars back in August. I see the seller increased the price. I don't respect that at all. Price gouging is disgusting. Sellers are taking advantage of the increased need for home office furniture and supplies.In terms of the chair, there are better options out there. The chair was easy for me to assemble. It took about 20 minutes. There really is no support in the cushion. And the worst part is it squeaks so loudly. Every movement on the chair, there is a loud jarring squeak. I've tried using products to lubricate the moving parts and nothing has worked. The chair works for it's intended purpose, sitting at a desk. It's loud and uncomfortable. I would not recommend it. For the current listed price of eighty dollars, there are better options.

## 501                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    I bought this chair for my 6 yr old to use for virtual learning at home.  It's a cheap office chair, but she's little, so no big deal.  It was easy to assemble.  It's comfortable enough.  BUT - the hydraulic is shot within 45 days of use by a 6 yr old...  She's not constantly adjusting it up and down.  Over time, any weight in the seat lowers the hydraulic instantly.  Now she can't sit high enough to be at her desk.  I tried to return it, but Amazon said I'd need to box it up.  Nobody has time to disassemble a busted chair and find a box for it to fit in.Learn from my lesson.  Buy a different chair.  Or buy this one and go ahead and buy a replacement hydraulic lift cylinder because you're going to need one.
## 502                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               I purchased this chair for fifty dollars back in August. I see the seller increased the price. I don't respect that at all. Price gouging is disgusting. Sellers are taking advantage of the increased need for home office furniture and supplies.In terms of the chair, there are better options out there. The chair was easy for me to assemble. It took about 20 minutes. There really is no support in the cushion. And the worst part is it squeaks so loudly. Every movement on the chair, there is a loud jarring squeak. I've tried using products to lubricate the moving parts and nothing has worked. The chair works for it's intended purpose, sitting at a desk. It's loud and uncomfortable. I would not recommend it. For the current listed price of eighty dollars, there are better options.
